region:
To ensure page content is contained by landmarks, you need to use ARIA (Accessible Rich Internet Applications) landmark roles or HTML5 structural elements. These landmarks help assistive technology users, like screen reader users, to navigate and identify different sections of the web page. Example: Here's a simple example of a web page with content contained by landmarks using HTML5 elements: ```html Example Web Page

Website Title

  • Home
  • About
  • Contact

Article Title

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer nec odio. Praesent libero.

Related Links

  • Link 1
  • Link 2

© 2022 Example Web Page. All rights reserved.

``` In this example, we used the following HTML5 elements as landmarks: - `
`: Represents the header of the web page, containing the website title and navigation. - `
`: Represents the navigation section, containing the main menu. - `
`: Represents the main content of the web page, containing the article and aside elements. - `
`: Represents a self-contained piece of content, such as a blog post or news article. - `
`: Represents a section related to the main content, such as a sidebar with related links. - `
`: Represents the footer of the web page, containing copyright information. These landmarks help assistive technology users quickly navigate through the web page and understand the structure of the content.
